title: Why Am I Not Getting Emails? Troubleshoot When Gmail Isnâ€™t Working

steps.title: If your storage is full, you can't receive any emails.
steps.content: If your storage is full, you can't receive any emails. Go to https://one.google.com/storage to see how much space you're currently using between Gmail, Photos, and Google Drive. You might need to delete some files to free up space so you can get emails to your Gmail account or you can pay for more storage space.

steps.title: You won't see an email in your inbox if it was marked as any of these.
steps.content: You won't see an email in your inbox if it was marked as any of these. You can easily search for the email to find it. To search for the missing email, Click the filter icon in the search box. Change "All Mail" to Mail & Spam & Trash . Enter any keywords that you remember in the missing email. If you don't remember any, leave the fields blank. Click Search .

steps.title: You won't see the email if a filter hides it in another folder.
steps.content: You won't see the email if a filter hides it in another folder. To find out if you have filters active, go to Settings > Filters and Blocked Addresses . Look for filters including "Delete it" or "Skip inbox" and click the Edit or Delete option. Follow the on-screen instructions to get rid of that filter.

steps.title: The original email might be in your archive, but you won't see the email in your inbox.
steps.content: The original email might be in your archive, but you won't see the email in your inbox. Go to Settings > Forwarding and POP/IMAP > and look if you have forwarding activated. If you want to keep forwarding active but want to see the emails in your Gmail account as well, make sure Keep Gmail's copy in the Inbox is selected. Click Save Changes when you're done.

steps.title: Make sure you have settings configured correctly if you use another email client.
steps.content: Make sure you have settings configured correctly if you use another email client. Email clients include Outlook and Apple Mail.

steps.title: You won't see emails if your network is too slow or intermittent.
steps.content: You won't see emails if your network is too slow or intermittent. You need a strong and consistent connection to the internet so you can receive and send emails. You may need to restart your router/modem if you haven't done that in a while. To restart, simply unplug your router/modem from power for a few minutes, then plug everything back in! Check out this wikiHow article for more steps to speed up a slow internet connection .

steps.title: While not frequent, the Gmail servers could be down.
steps.content: While not frequent, the Gmail servers could be down. If the servers are down, you won't be getting new emails to your account. Go to https://www.google.com/appsstatus/dashboard/ to see if Gmail is online.
